Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 04:29PM chemochar wrote:       HI I'M CHAR.  I HAVEN'T POSTED MUCH STUFF BUT THIS I JUST HAD TO REPLY TO.  MY NEUROPATHY STARTED AFTER CHEMO AND GOT SO BAD THAT I COULD NOT TIE A KNOT OR EVEN CLOSE MY RIGHT HAND.  I SAW MY ONC IN DECEMBER--HE SAID WHAT IS LEFT OF  THE NEUROPATHY ( AND BELIEVE ME THERE IS SOME LEFT)  WILL MOST LIKELY NEVER GO AWAY.  MY PLASTIC SURGEON HAD A COLLEGUE WHO HAD TO RETIRE BECAUSE HE COULD NOT DO SURGERIES ANYMORE!  THEY DON'T TELL US THIS STUFF, DO THEY?    ANYWAY, SORRY ABOUT COMPLAINING--YOURS COULD VERY WELL DISAPPEAR AS I HOPE MINE WILL!
Posts.Title: Neuropathy After Chemo??? mbf BilateralBeauties

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2013 11:44PM chemochar wrote: I was 61. Had no idea I had breast cancer--the mammo found it 2 months before my 62nd birthday. Had my mastectomy 5 days before my birthday. Now my birthdays are a blessing and I'm gad to be alive!! My mom was diagnosed at age 79--she died s a result of car accident.
Posts.Title: Would you mind sharing your age at time of diagnosis? ByFaith Gussy
